content.description: Another short, but easier climb. Climb the hand crack all the way to the top.
content.location: See topo. Start at the base of the tree (stump) above the cave entrance.

content.description:
The route called "Twin Cracks" is located slightly to the left (north) of "Difficult Crack," which climbs the NW arete of Brother's Buttress.

 Source: Collett, Bill. "River Rock: A Climber's Guide to Mississippi Palisades State Park." Granite Pub, 1991
Climb the face around the corner from Dihedral Crack.
content.location: See topo. Near the cave entrance just around the corner (to the left) from Difficult Crack.

content.description: Struggle up and through the triangular niche set in the wall about ten feet up.
content.location: See topo. Overhanging finger crack 6 feet west of Airhead.

content.description: start at center of face, easy classic climb
content.protection: TR pro or webbing at top. Available casual scramble to the top to build the anchor.
content.location: Twin Sisters area located on south face of Brother Buttress

content.description: Climb the chimney. The chockstone jammed in there will provide a bit of a challenge - it is easiest passed with a long stem across the chimney.
content.location: Chimney on the left side of the north face.

content.description: Begin on the block and follow a tiny seam up and to the right.
content.protection: Thin pro, if at all. Available casual scramble to the top to build a TR anchor.
content.location: See topo. Begin on the block at the level of the horizontal crack 6 feet off the ground.

content.description: Follow a series of ledges on the corner of the buttress.
content.location: See topo. Southwest corner of the buttress.

content.description: This route is a challenge right from the start.  The crux is at the bottom where a short 7ft crack turns horizontal to meet up with the rest of the crack just to the right of it.  Using a nice jug that's deep in the crack and some clever smearing you can set yourself up nicely to make the transition between the two cracks.  After the crux is below you a series of well placed hand jams will give you success.
content.protection: There is one large boulder and one 3ft round boulder on top of the bluff that make for great top rope anchors but if your short on gear there are some good living trees that will do the trick if set up properly. Available casual scramble to the top.
content.location: The route is in the brother's buttress and twin sisters area and is just to the right at you pass the lower wall of the twin sisters on the trail that comes up from the road, parking lot, and outhouses below.

content.description: Crack to the right of Java on the south face of Brother Buttress
content.protection: Top rope slings around boulders or a couple of cams and nuts. Available casual scramble to the top to build the anchor.
content.location: Twin Sisters area Brother Buttress south face

content.description: This short but challenging climb follows the crack that starts at finger size and opens up to off-width hands, on the corner of the North face. Climb the crack using a layback with your feet inside the chimney.
content.location: See topo. a Crack on the corner of the north face.
